You are given a list of integers with a single element initially. You can perform the following operation on the list:

* Remove any element $x$ from the list, where $x > 1$, and insert it sequentially at the same position.

Repeat this operation until all elements in the list are either 0 or 1.

You are then given two integers, $l$ and $r$ (where $1 \le l \le r \le n$, and $n$ is the length of the final list).

Find the total number of 1s in the range from index $l$ to $r$ (inclusive) in the final list.

You are given a list of numbers. You can repeatedly remove a number greater than 1 from the list and insert it back in at the same position. Continue doing this until all the numbers in the list are either 0 or 1.  Count how many 1s are in a specific range of the final list.
